titleStmt.title: Royal and other innocent bloud crying aloud to heaven for due vengeance. Humbly represented to the Right Honourable the Lords and Commons assembled in Parliament. And with all humble dutifull submission dedicated to the two high and mighty princes, James Duke of York and Henry Duke of Gloucester, his sacred Majestyes Royal brethren. By George Starkey, a true honourer and faithfull friend of his country.
titleStmt.author: Starkey, George, 1627-1665.

publicationStmt.publisher: printed by A. Warren for Daniel White at the sign of the Seven-stars in St. Paul's Church-yard,

notesStmt.note: Presenting his enthusiastic support of the Restoration and indicating his enthusiastic royalistic sympathies, and urging retaliation on the Puritan party.
Reproductions of the original in the British Library.

place.placeName: the sign of the Seven-stars in St. Paul's Church-yard
